theme: Future with will going to and present continuous
mode: Tech Interview (Planning): Discuss roadmap changes, deployment windows and how you plan future releases

theme: Conditionals first and second
mode: Tech Interview (Incident Response): If a critical API goes down, what would you do and what if rollback fails

theme: There is there are there was there were
mode: Tech Interview (System Audit): Describe what services exist, where bottlenecks were, and what components are missing

theme: Passive voice in simple present and simple past
mode: Tech Interview (Postmortem): Explain how the outage was detected, how alerts were triggered, and what was remediated

theme: Present perfect and present continuous
mode: Tech Interview (Experience): What problems you have solved recently and what you are currently improving in production

theme: Modal verbs can must should might
mode: Tech Interview (Security): What developers must do for JWT/OAuth2, what they should log, and what might be optional

theme: Phrasal verbs take off give up find out look for
mode: Tech Interview (Debugging): How you look for memory leaks, find out slow queries, and track down flaky tests

theme: Gerunds and infinitives after verbs like love enjoy stop try
mode: Tech Interview (Team Fit): Things you enjoy doing, tasks you stopped doing, and improvements you tried to introduce

theme: Comparatives and superlatives plus too enough
mode: Tech Interview (Tradeoffs): Compare SQL vs NoSQL, monolith vs microservices, and choose the most appropriate stack

theme: Reported speech statements and questions
mode: Tech Interview (Stakeholders): Report what product said, what SRE asked, and how leadership framed priorities

theme: Relative clauses defining and non defining
mode: Tech Interview (Design): Describe components that handle requests and caches which reduce database load

theme: Simple past and past continuous
mode: Tech Interview (Root Cause): What you were deploying when the error happened and how the fix was applied later

theme: Used to and would
mode: Tech Interview (Evolution): How the team used to deploy manually and how you would automate with CI/CD now

theme: So neither either too enough
mode: Tech Interview (Collaboration): Neither frontend nor backend owned the contract, so how did you define API boundaries

theme: Wish and if only
mode: Tech Interview (Retrospective): What you wish you had instrumented and if only you had added idempotency earlier

theme: Quantifiers some any much many few little
mode: Tech Interview (Metrics): How many requests per second, how much latency budget, and any SLOs you proposed or met

theme: Articles a an the zero article
mode: Tech Interview (API Design): Explain a versioning strategy for an API and the zero downtime migration approach

theme: Adverbs of frequency and degree
mode: Tech Interview (Ops): How often deploys happen, how rarely rollbacks occur, and how strongly alerts should fire

theme: Causative have and get
mode: Tech Interview (Ownership): When you would have the CDN purge cache and how to get pipelines to run smoke tests automatically

theme: Verb patterns and object complements
mode: Tech Interview (Coaching): How you mentored a junior to become a reliable on-call engineer and code reviewer

theme: Third conditional and mixed conditionals
mode: Tech Interview (What-ifs): If you had added rate limiting earlier, how would traffic spikes have been handled differently

theme: Inversion and emphasis
mode: Tech Interview (Performance): Never had the JVM heap grown so fast—explain GC tuning and profiling steps you took

theme: Collocations with make and do
mode: Tech Interview (Delivery): Make a release plan, do a canary rollout, and make monitoring dashboards actionable

theme: Describing people and personality
mode: Tech Interview (Team Dynamics): Describe the ideal teammate for code reviews and incident collaboration under pressure

theme: Narrative tenses mixed
mode: Tech Interview (Career Story): Tell a story about a hard migration you led from monolith to microservices

theme: Polite requests and offers with modals would could can
mode: Tech Interview (Pair Programming): Could you refactor this NestJS controller and would you add proper DTO validation

theme: Job interview language present perfect achievements and future plans
mode: Tech Interview (Achievements): You have reduced latency by 40% and plan to roll out Kafka for async flows—explain how

theme: Modals of deduction must might could cant in present and past
mode: Tech Interview (Troubleshooting): The spike must be a thundering herd, it could be cache stampede—walk through proof steps

theme: Present perfect continuous and time expressions for since recently lately
mode: Tech Interview (Learning): You have been experimenting with OpenTelemetry lately—describe tracing setup end to end

theme: Comparatives superlatives and complex quantifiers far way considerably slightly
mode: Tech Interview (Benchmarks): Which approach is considerably faster—connection pooling or per-request opens—justify with data

theme: Passive voice in headlines and concise reporting
mode: Tech Interview (Status Update): Services were scaled, limits were raised, and alarms were silenced—summarize crisply

theme: Phrasal verbs set 2 turn down set up back up carry on work out
mode: Tech Interview (DevOps): Set up CI with Jenkins, back up databases nightly, and carry on after failed deployments safely

theme: Used to would be going to in life changes
mode: Tech Interview (Migration): The team used to run VMs and is going to move to Kubernetes—outline the plan and risks

theme: Conditionals first second and third for apologies and solutions
mode: Tech Interview (Customer Impact): If the SLA is missed, how do you communicate, and what would you change next time

theme: Present perfect in professional context and passive voice
mode: Tech Interview (Releases): A new feature has been rolled out behind a flag—explain your canary and metrics checks

theme: Reported speech wh questions yes no questions commands
mode: Tech Interview (Cross-team): PM asked why error rates rose, SRE asked when they started—summarize the conversation clearly

theme: Requests clarifying questions and softening language
mode: Tech Interview (Code Review): Could you clarify the concurrency model and would you mind adding tests for edge cases

theme: Sequencers first then after that finally and imperatives
mode: Tech Interview (Runbook): First take a heap dump, then check GC logs, after that scale replicas, finally verify SLOs

theme: Present perfect vs past simple travel experiences
mode: Tech Interview (Cloud): You have worked with AWS and you migrated from on-prem—explain networking and IAM challenges

theme: Future forms will going to present continuous for plans and predictions
mode: Tech Interview (Capacity): Traffic will double next quarter, we are going to shard the DB—walk through your plan

theme: Obligation and advice must have to should ought to
mode: Tech Interview (Compliance): Services must encrypt at rest, logs should omit PII, and access has to be audited—explain how

theme: Emphasis cleft sentences and inversion rarely little seldom
mode: Tech Interview (Reliability): Rarely do we accept single points of failure—design an HA architecture for the gateway

theme: Simple past with moral lessons and adverbs of frequency
mode: Tech Interview (Lessons): We often skipped load tests and paid for it—describe what you changed afterward

theme: Past perfect and narrative sequencing
mode: Tech Interview (Timeline): The team had prepared feature flags before the release—explain the sequence and results

theme: Mixed conditionals and speculation
mode: Tech Interview (Hypothesis): If caches had been warmed, users would not have seen 5xx—prove or refute with metrics

theme: Relative clauses restrictive and non restrictive
mode: Tech Interview (Data Model): Tables that store orders and indexes which speed up queries—justify your schema design

theme: Tag questions and confirming information politely
mode: Tech Interview (Alignment): The service needs idempotency, doesn’t it You prefer outbox pattern, don’t you Confirm tradeoffs

theme: Question forms inversion and indirect questions
mode: Tech Interview (DSA): Could you implement LRU in TypeScript How would you analyze time and space complexity

theme: Adverbs of degree and intensifiers really quite rather absolutely
mode: Tech Interview (Frontend): The page is really slow on first paint—explain code splitting, memoization and hydration issues

theme: Quantifiers and comparatives with too and enough
mode: Tech Interview (Capacity): Too many open DB connections and not enough worker threads—how do you tune the pool safely

theme: Gerunds and infinitives after advise suggest recommend plan
mode: Tech Interview (Guidance): Recommend adding a circuit breaker, suggest retry with backoff, and plan chaos testing sessions

theme: Obligation permission and prohibition must have to may can cannot
mode: Tech Interview (Auth): What clients may access admin APIs, what must be forbidden, and how OIDC scopes are enforced

theme: Causative have get and letting someone do something
mode: Tech Interview (Ownership Model): Get the pipeline to run DB migrations, have QA run smoke tests, and let SRE approve cutover

theme: Comparatives superlatives and review language
mode: Tech Interview (Perf Review): Compare this quarter with the last, highlight the most impactful work, and gaps to improve

theme: Discourse markers however although therefore meanwhile otherwise
mode: Tech Interview (Architecture): Although simple, the design scales; however, the cache may thrash—defend your choices logically

theme: Hedging and stance it seems apparently arguably likely
mode: Tech Interview (Risk): It seems the root cause is load shedding; arguably config drift—explain uncertainty and next steps

theme: There is there are plus prepositions of place
mode: Tech Interview (Topology): There are services behind an API gateway and caches in front of the DB—explain why they are placed there

theme: Imperatives zero and first conditional for safety
mode: Tech Interview (Runbook Safety): Do not deploy on red alerts; if error rate spikes, freeze releases and page on-call immediately

theme: Future perfect and future continuous
mode: Tech Interview (Roadmap): By next quarter we will have migrated to Kafka and we will be streaming audit logs—outline milestones

theme: Reported orders requests and suggestions
mode: Tech Interview (Leadership): CTO suggested raising SLOs, security requested mTLS, and product ordered feature flags—prioritize them

theme: Relative pronouns and participle clauses
mode: Tech Interview (Code Walkthrough): Modules that consume messages, services processing payments, and tasks executed asynchronously—explain flow

theme: Time expressions meanwhile afterwards by the time ever since
mode: Tech Interview (Timeline): Meanwhile QA validated, afterwards SRE tuned limits, and by the time we deployed traffic had doubled—recap clearly

theme: Passive with by phrases and agent omission
mode: Tech Interview (Change Log): Limits were increased by SRE and configs were updated—explain without over-attributing blame

theme: Prepositions of time and polite announcements
mode: Tech Interview (Coordination): At 09:00 deploy starts, by noon canary ends, during the afternoon full rollout—communicate the plan politely
